text: Great, friendly service. But, its the type of place where the pancake syrup comes in single serving packets, which is fine for some restaurants, but the prices would have to justify that. I wouldn't expect real maple syrup from a Deluxe Breakfast Platter from McD's, for example.  But it's not just about the syrup. Overall, seems overpriced for what you get. Sausage links (breakfast) tasted generic. As did everything else really. Just generic. So prices should've been generic too, but they weren't.  Public restroom for the building was gross, I should add.

Small, quaint diner inside what I'm assuming is a hotel? Yelp kind of steered me in the wrong direction trying to find this place, but I got there just fine. The breakfast food is like any other type of diner food, gets the job done. I'm giving it a 2 stars because of the cost of their dishes. I know it's smack dab in the middle of downtown, but I could have taken the bus a few minutes outside the city and found the same thing for less.

Very basic breakfast.  Food quality wasn't bad except for what they call biscuits.  Those biscuits were not biscuits, more like a roll.  Get an omelet or another egg breakfast and you will be fine.  It is kind of hard to find, as there is no sign on the street.  It is located inside an office building.  The service was fine, and no wait for a table.

I wouldn't return. The customer service felt obligatory, and the communication between the waitress and the kitchen staff was totally off. I ordered a breakfast croissant, but what I got was the "Le Croissant" which is a different sandwich all together (the latter has Carmelites onion and Gouda, whereas the former has American cheese and bacon). Notwithstanding that I ordered a "breakfast croissant" the waitress turned to the cook and said "she meant to order the breakfast croissant." Basically, she tried to make it seem as though it was my mistake and not hers. Not ok.  In addition to the sandwich I ordered some hash browns. They were so bland, undercooked and flimsy. I ate a spoonful and was over it.  The customer service and mediocre food mean I won't be returning here.

Very disappointing. I am a breakfast person, so I am picky. This place is just ok, the food is nothing special at all but a least the portions were a good size. I had the veggie omelet and my husband has the corned beef hash & eggs. Both were ok. I would expect more garnishment and pico de gallo or salsa or avocado or something to dress the omelet and make it look better and compliment the flavors. The hash browns were good and corned beef was homemade but really tasted average. My biggest complaint is the service. It took three request to get coffee. We finally got it after our meal was over. Our server had about 25 tables. That is ridiculous - management should have enough people on staff to handle a Saturday morning crowd. I wouldn't go back, in fact, I would go wait for an hour  to get a table at Wild Berry cafe. Yes, Wild Berry is that much better.

My wife and I ate breakfast on a Saturday morning at Pittsfield Cafe for our first time. The wait was 15 minutes. She had the ribeye skillet and I had the meat lovers scrambler.  I had coffee and ahe had ice water.  We did not talk much during the meal because we were ravenous.  It was more like sounds of "mmmmmm" and  "so glad I ordered this."  Our bill total was about $24. We will breakfast here again!

Went her for breakfast on our first morning in Chicago and it didn't disappoint. In a cool location, with quick and friendly service, and great food. The steak and egg breakfast was spot on! Was with a friend with a gluten allergy and they had good knowledge of the menu and were able to advise. Would definitely go back.

Good place to get a no fufu diner breakfast. In today's dining world of tofu infused with locally grown organic kale, this place was a pleasant diversion.  The meat lovers omelette was very good. French toast with strawberries was tasty.  The Belgian waffle was okay. The Latte was very good. Not badly priced for Chicago.  You need a key for the bathrooms, which are down the stairs and in pretty bad condition.

Oh, Pittsfield Cafe, you're a diamond in the rough. A hidden greasy spoon. Pittsfield Cafe is a diner style restaurant tucked away behind the diamond storefronts of Jewelers Row, nestled in the lobby of a mixed office, retail, and apartment building.  If you're looking for a no-frills, good food served quickly spot - this is the place. The menu is expansive but don't expect anything trendy. Bonus: Breakfast is served all day! The coffee isn't great but gets the job done. You can expect the same from the servers; their quick and efficient. The food really is good; my favorites are the West Coast Omelette, the Greek Opa Omelette, and the Full Monty ($8). Prices are fair. Seating at the old school bar inside or outside on the "patio" is the best. If you get there after 930 you can expect to wait for a table.

This is THE place to grab breakfast in downtown.  Food was incredible, service was great and the architecture of he lobby made it a cool place.  My son and I try different breakfast places when we travel.  This is a favorite.  The Chef Recommends is the best on the menu.  Skip the overpriced brunch spots and dig into this for a real breakfast.

Hidden inside a building in downtown Chicago, it was a bit hard to find, but very cute! Eating here makes you feel like you're having a meal in the 1970s. We came here for a late breakfast/lunch. The coffee was decent, and the food was pretty standard diner food, maybe slightly better than your neighborhood diner might be. Service was okay, nothing outstanding. Pretty good place for food if you're craving an American breakfast but nothing too wonderful.

This place was great for a quick, no fuss breakfast. We were headed to the Art Institute and just needed some fuel. The service was quick and courteous, and the food (especially the eggs) was perfectly executed. Their Bloody Mary was good too! I would totally come back.
This simple cafe offers Vienna all beef hotdogs in the atrium of a venerable old building. It's a nice place to stop for a bite while enjoying the ornate trim of the historic building.

Food is absolutely delicious and the service was great! My husband and I went for breakfast/brunch. I ordered the Le croissant sandwich with bacon and American cheese (pick what cheese you want) and caramelized onion jam and a side of hash browns. Can't describe how delicious the croissant sandwich was, probably the best I've ever had! Now, I'm a lover of hash browns, have to be honest these definitely weren't the best they were just a tad under cooked for my taste but still yummy! Service was awesome and food came out ridiculously fast, 5 stars all the way!

Yuuuuuuum! The skillet was chock full of flavorful veggies, but the Bloody Mary was definitely where it was at! It came with a skewer full of goodies, and the spicy variation was the perfect amount of flavor and spice. The location right next to Millennium Park was perfect, and it was very reasonably priced. I'll definitely be back on my next trip to Chicago!

After reading The top reviews, I was looking forward to trying out this new place.  The service was ok , food was average at BEST!.... Hash browns were uncooked and asked to get a cooked version and received a burnt slop of mess. English muffin were barely toasted and eggs were so-so. We walked out of there still hungry... At least the coffee was good but I can't give this more than 2 stars.

After reading all the reviews, I was excited about checking this place out! After eating there, I'm totally disappointed! I had the avocado benedict with a side of bacon and a mimosa.   The flavor of the food, at best was average. The bacon had no flavor, the hash browns were not cooked, and the mimosa was expensive OJ. The lady who waited on me was nice but the others were not! Definitely do not recommend this place! You might be better off trying the cafe next door!
What a dive! I'm all for hole in the wall places but when my bacon is burnt to a crisp, toast is burnt, and coffee was so-so can't even begin to recommend this to anyone...not even the homeless.
Stopped for breakfast and it was a nice hidden gem to find while visiting Chicago. The portions were nice. The food was filling. Service was on point.

This is the sort of place I live for when I visit the States! A real traditional diner serving good honest food (and every type of food there is) around the clock with minimal fuss and effort of being there.  Pulling up a seat at the counter (another thing I don't do loads of in the UK...) the waitress settled me in whilst I went for another non British start to the day - Steak and eggs for breakfast! Served with hashbrowns and a side of avocado, it really sorted me out and set me up for the day - really well cooked and great value for $20 with loads of coffee.  Really great experience - perfect for breakfast - Love it!

So...after reading how this place is a hidden gem I kust had to stop by for breakfast. Its not the easiest to find but if you find the Pittsfield Building just let your nose take you to the cafe.  The servers here seem to have been doing this forever and a day! The orange juice was fantastic. My skillet was superb. Pancakes were delish. I will be coming back to try out the lunch items. This place was excellent. Do yourself a favor and just go!!! *this is a hole-in-the-wall type of place so if you like posh places this is not it.

Really impressive place for the prices you pay! It's a busy down to earth diner. The food was really good. Avocado Eggs Benedict was surprisingly good and the Le croissant came in a close second. Only downside was that it's pretty crowded (so you know it's good :) and the order took forever to come out! Still, this is a great first impression of Chicago!

The Mediterranean omelette was more than just unpleasant. It tasted like bad oil and was difficult to eat. When asked to speak to the manager, it took her 15 minutes and several requests to come by and once she did she was very defensive and not accommodating.

I love the hidden-away aspect of this cute diner with tables in the atrium of the historic Pittsfield Building. You may have walked by this building a hundred times and never realized what was inside. I had lunch there with a friend on a work day, and I took advantage of the fact that they serve a variety of breakfast items all day. My egg sandwich on a croissant was classic, very tasty, and actually twice the size of what I could eat. I also had a pretty good latte. This is not a gourmet foodie spot, but you'll get something tasty for a good price and enjoy the unusual space.

I feel pretty dumb that I've worked on Michigan Avenue for decades and never been in this great dinner/coffee shop. To those who remember the old Cambridge House on Ohio, this is as good or better. Friendly service, satisfying breakfast and lunch options, plus a lunch counter where you can read and people watch. Plus, they make a classic old fashioned chili that begs for crackers. The building it's in, the Pittsfield Building, is a classic deco structure with amazing architectural details you can stare at while you eat. Don't miss out.
Real old feel but really good honest food! btw, its in a cool but slightly creepy looking feeling building.
Breakfast was delicious. Everything tasted homemade. Every waitress was friendly and welcoming. My favorite was the steak and eggs...yummy!

Food was decent, not exceptional. I ordered the Avocado Benedict. The hollandaise sauce was a little disappointing with not a lot of flavor. The hashbrowns were plain, tasted like the bulk pre-frozen kind. It is St. Patrick's celebration weekend, so it was crowded, rushed, a long wait as well. Everyone was nice though, and the service was good.

A surprisingly charming breakfast spot downtown. Conveniently located, and situated inside the Pittsfield Building, this cafe is a great place to meet a friend for breakfast in the loop.  The tables are set out in the lobby of the building, which takes on the air of a little Italian courtyard, only without the open air.  (In Chicago, the fact that it's not in the open air means that it's usable year-round, so consider that a plus.) And the food is diner food, but above par for the city of Chicago.  The coffee is strong, the southwestern omelet had noticeable character (including genuinely fresh jalapeno peppers in it), the service is quick and undramatic.   This place just became my go-to spot for Loop breakfast meetings.

this place changed my life. food was pretty great but i was so impressed by how fast the service was that i can not stop thinking about it. it's been three hours and i'm still thinking about it- felt magical. i love a good pancake and i had two good pancakes here.

From sitting down to eating my food was not even 10 minutes. Nice cafe with GREAT prices for the food you get and it was great by the way....I will be back when I visit the windy city and I high recommend this place...
Decent breakfast.  Usually get the 2 egg combo with choice of meat, hash browns, and toast!  Price is a bit high and not the friendliest owner.

Great breakfast. I got the breakfast burrito and the chipotle hollandaise makes it perfect. My boyfriend wanted benedicts but they stop serving them after 11 am so they recommend an avocado skillet (not listed on the menu) and got the chipotle hollandaise on the side. He said "WOW". So we were both happy campers! Plus it's inside an older building and you can sit in a lobby setting. It's quite nice with lots great architecture.

After walking to a couple other breakfast shops we found this Lille off the beat place. That was amazing.  Thersa made us feel welcome in this great little spot.  The food was amazing and fast.  I highly recommend
From out of town, looking for breakfast and found this place. Trust me go here it's soo good. Anything on the menu. I had the corned beef with hash browns omelette. Donna my server was amazing!

It's a pretty standard diner that delivers great food and excellent service.  It's inside the building and to the left of the lobby off Washington street so it's a little hidden, but for the prices, food and service it can't be beat.

Awesome service! Literally had coffee within thirty seconds of sitting down, and our meal came in about 10 minutes. Generous portions, and the meal was delicious. The French toast was amazing. Definitely my new go to spot in Chicago for breakfast!

It was awesome that we walked into this friendly cafe in town while we were trying to look for some other restaurants. The service was very efficient but fantastic. We ordered the steak with scrambled and hash brown also the brekky burrito. The burrito was so AWESOME that I had to share with others. Moreover, the soup had heaps of ingredients such as Boston clams, celery, capsicums and potatoes. I'd recommend people who are after great meals to give it a go!

The gf and I were in the area and needed to fuel up for the day. Well this place was a great place to do it at.  First off it can be a little tricky to find if you aren't looking for it seeing you have to walk into the building and head down to the center of it and the cafe is on your left.  Nice little place and not overly crowded on a Saturday around 10. My girlfriend got the meat omelet and I got the steak skillet. Both were great and honestly half of it would have been filling enough.  The quickness of the service however was unreal. Seriously, it maybe took 5-8 mins to get our food and it was piping hot!  The price also was great for downtown Chicago. Both meals for around 20 bucks is more than worth it!

Hands down the best cheap breakfast in the loop/Millennium Park area. I have been several times and it is my go to. The breakfast specials are great.. French toast, pancakes, etc. The Santa Fe Skillet is AMAZING (ask easy on jalapeno if you don't handle the spice). Most importantly the bloody Mary is great. Garnished with Mini-meal of salami, cheese, & olive. Service is top notch.

We were starving during a day trip to Chicago so we found this gem on Yelp and decided to get some food. We almost missed it because the cafe is located inside the Pittsfield Building but luckily, we glimpsed the sign and rushed in to get out from the cold. The cafe is a little crowded, but the food and service were pretty good. They have a huge selection of food, so there's something for everyone. I wish I had known about their Bloody Mary's but I'll just have to go back and try it!

A diner in the Loop?  Thank you!  This place was here way before Wildberry came to be.  I think it pretty much could kick Wildberry's ass.  The Pittsfield building this diner resides in is way cool.  Tons of character in the space, neat stuff to look at while you eat. Breakfasts shine here, lunches are OK but I recommend breakie over lunch.  And, really the prices for the loop are excellent.  I recommend their breakfast burrito with fresh avocado slices on top, all of their skillets and omelets are good too.  I always ask for my hash brown crispy and they oblige.  Not sure about the pancakes since I've never had them.  Decent coffee but if you are a coffee snob/hipster you won't think so. Oh, and do a liquid breakfast just for fun and get a bloody.  Their version is great, accompanied by awesome and salty garnishes.  Have two or three and then text your boss and say you can't make it today because you are feeling a bit dizzy.  I dare you!

I have lived in Chicago for over 20 years and have never been to Pittsfield cafe on Washington street in the loop. Until today I have been missing out the food is wonderful not heavy you would think that it's like every breakfast joint it's all the same. But it's not, it's all delicious fast and the location is just awesome. Inside the old historic Pittsfield building with sights to behold. Highly highly recommend this place.

First of all, I made an account solely to review this place. **FOOD: My one star goes towards the food. The food was alright, nothing special besides the prices given that the cafe is in downtown Chicago. I ordered a cinnamon banana french toast and the edges tasted like a fried egg. Maybe french toast is difficult to cook....I don't know. What I do know is that I got an upset stomach afterwards. **SERVICE: We came down here because Wildberry had an hour and a half wait and we were on a time crunch. The waitress never came to check up on us until she began telling us multiple times to pay and leave even though the place was probably half full and it didn't close for another hour (this was ridiculous). When we were ready to pay the waitress informed us that she could split the checks but she didn't want too because it was too hard and it was busy so it all went on my card. I've been a cashier at multiple places before and I know it is really not hard or time consuming to do this but I let it go. She stood there and interrupted us multiple times as we tried talking about how to pay so that it would only be one transaction.  She brought me the slip to sign and, already unhappy with the service, I gave her a 10% tip.  She took it and then came back and literally DEMANDED (in an incredibly condescending manner) that I give her more because  "in case you didn't know, this place is a /restaurant/! This isn't McDonalds, you need to tip me at least 15-20%!" Her voice was insulting and loud enough for everyone in area to hear. I have never been treated like this and, in shock, I tipped her 20% and left. As I left, a customer was arguing with her about being charged prices higher than what was on the menu and for things he didn't pay for.  TL;DR I don't eat at fast food chains but i'd rather go to mcdonalds than visit this place again. Cross the street and go to Wildberry ESPECIALLY if the ridiculous waitress is there.
Sat in the inside patio and there is construction taking place in the pittsfield building, so it was not a peaceful meal. The omlette was pretty good.

This little gem is a great value!! First of all we were not willing to wait for  over an hour at Wildberry.  So we came here instead and walked away very satisfied.   I had a great huge breakfast of two eggs, hash browns, French toast and two sausage links for under $8.00.  My hubbie had a great looking omelet that he said was terrific. And my son had French toast and eggs and he also enjoyed his food.  Eat here. It's fairly priced - great food and attentive service.

Perfect breakfast spot!  Does all the 'diner' stuff well (coffee and cocoa served quickly), and continual light check ins...but he real reason for 5 stars is the food!  Silver dollar pancakes were perfect and the West Coast Omelette was flawless!!  LOVE THIS SPOT!!

I have pretty high standards when it comes to breakfast and brunch; this place is a solid 3 stars in my book.  The restaurant is located inside the historic Pittsfield Building which makes for a fun setting. The restaurant has a counter area and booths, but no windows or outdoor patio.   We came here because we were too hungry to wait 90 minutes to be seated at Wildberry. The food at Pittsfield Cafe was good and reasonably priced, but nothing special or fancy.  Chicagoans don't mess around when it comes to brunch and the restaurants are always overflowing with hungry tourists, so be prepared for staff to be running around everywhere trying to keep up.
Very good breakfast. Big portions at low cost. Definitely worth checking out. And the bacon was crispy

Let me explain my negative grade:  We are long-time fans of Pancake House and we love it.  Today we wanted to give a shot at something different. Headed to Wildberry, we had to find an alternative because of a 200+ minutes wait.  This place is in an interesting location, but something is wrong in general.  1) tables in the patio are cold now in December, just imagine in Jan/Feb 2) more important, all the 4 eggs of our benedicts were way too overcooked (hard): no good!! 3) hollandaise felt little too greasy 4) breakfast syrup for the pancakes is served cold  5) pancakes are nothing special at all 6) French toast is too chewy 7) scrambled eggs for my baby were overcooked and resembled an omelette instead  So, I can't understand the average of 4 full stars.  I would have given it a 3 if it weren't for the overcooked eggs.  Prices are good.

What an amazing brunch spot. It was a little confusing to find until we realized it was in a hotel lobby. Actually they have tables set out in the foyer of the hotel, which we opted to sit at. So we only got a quick glance at the inside of the cafe.  The food was really delicious. I got one corned beef skillet with scrambled eggs and another with eggs over-easy. I would recommend sticking with scrambled eggs - the yolk from the over-easy eggs kind of overpowered the taste of the corned beef. Didn't get any drinks, we were trying to recover from the night before. It wasn't too crowded so our food was served really fast and our waitress was really attentive.  The prices here are unbelievable, especially for being located in the Loop.  Overall: great brunch spot. Nice environment and good experience. Definitely will be back.

Great place for breakfast food! We are visiting from out of town and we're looking for a place to grab breakfast food late in the morning. We all had skillets and they were all great!! The service was quick and friendly. Great people!! My only complaint isn't even a complaint, the building is just under a lot of construction and the bathrooms were awfully gross.
Great location within a gorgeous building. Good service. Food was delicious and reasonably priced.

This place is a hidden casual-gem. It's actually located inside a hotel. I got the west coast and it is amazing! The avocado, cheese, peppers and eggs blended very well. Add some black pepper and salt and this becomes perfection.  Would recommend.

The is a great little place not that far off the beaten path. Comfortable atmosphere. The service and food was great!!!!! I was there for breakfast every morning during my visit to Chicago. You will really have to look for the entrance as it is kind of hidden from the street, but it is well worth the look.
Nothing fancy, but pretty tasty, and a good price. Nice people working, too.

I go here about once a week, since it as a block away from where I work. The food is always good for the price, it is super fast, and they waitresses are usally pretty nice and helpful. The managers can be kind of rude, especially to the other staff members, but overall it is a nice place to grab lunch.

Teresa is a gem! We stumbled in looking like death and she took care of us.  Great place to start your morning! Affordable, quick. And yummy! It is a hidden cafe in the Pittsfield building.  Ps- the Bloody marys will make your hairs tingle
hidden gem! what a great place for breakfast. we love it a lot! We didn't even wait long to get a seat and our food. its very efficient and friendly service! recommended place to go!

Decent food. They were too packed and didn't have the staff to service all of their customers properly. Our waitress gave us our food and didn't come back the entire time we were there. Not a great experience and we probably will not return.

A great place to go too when you want to cure your hangover with a huge bloody mary. My hungover friends and I came here on a Saturday afternoon. It's hidden in the back of a vintage lobby. Really cute breakfast dinner with old school Grease-style decor. Our waitress was great with a refreshing down to earth and funny personality,  The bloody Mary is a meal in it self~ its friggin good.  The santa fe burrito was delicious and reasonably price (thank god). Come here for breakfast if you want a reasonably priced meal and drink in the expensive downtown city of chicago.
Very nice and cozy place. Its tucked away inside a building so find #55 washington st 1st then its inside. Got a greek skillet. It was really good (and cheap for downtown prices).

Coming from out of town and needed to give my wallet a break from the more pricier options the city has to offer. Stopped in and it's a pretty nice looking diner/cafe. I ordered the biscuits and gravy, side of bacon, and coffee for about $10. Everything was great except the bacon which was a little too crispy....almost burnt. Other then that everything was excellent including no the atmosphere and service. What's even better is the food came out easily within 5 min. Great place!

I ordered the French Toast combo, delicious. They use very thick bread so they are nice and fluffy. I really liked that the apple juice i ordered was served in a sealed bottle. The location of the restaurant is really awesome too. You can almost miss it because the restaurant is inside a building (I believe its a hotel but I can't tell). I wish I wasn't just visiting Chicago because I would've loved to come back.

Diamond in the rough! What a great breakfast and brunch place!  The Bloody Mary's are the that I've had homemade in a long time. The service is awesome too especially Teresa...smiling and funny! If you can find it , I highly recommend it!

We went in on a Saturday and weren't very satisfied with anything.  Took 15 minutes to have someone ask for our order. When we got the food, my friends grilled cheese was burnt and my hamburger bun was split on the bottom.
Hidden little gem of a spot. We scarfed down a breakfast and it was so delicious. The coffee is also really good - icing on the breakfast cake. Efficient and friendly service.

Absolutely spectacular. We got off the south shore line and were going to try Wildberry but it was a 45min wait and it seemed like it would be a glorified IHOP. We were looking for a delicious brunch hole in the wall authentic Chicago food and we found it at Pittsfield!! No wait, expedient and friendly service and the food was exactly what we were craving. French toast perfectly cooked, I had Turkey sausage patties that were the perfect side of protein to my carb loaded breakfast! Coffee was right on point and we were eating within minutes of sitting down. Server was friendly and quick and witty all the things I love about hometown diners. I would come here again in a heartbeat, the exact thing we needed for a quick breakfast before heading off to the airport. Its hidden away inside a building and you might miss it with all the construction around but trust us it's worth searching for and stopping in. Wish we had a spot like this in Utah! Thanks for a stellar brunch Pittsfield! See you on our next pit stop to Chicago!

Located INSIDE 55 E Washington in a very old building, in the interior building lobby on 1st floor. Faux patio area inside is festive.  Good food, nice servers, great location near Michigan Avenue.  Full menu, including beer.  We enjoyed the food.  Classic diner fare prepared very well and served hot and fast.  It was very busy the morning we visited.
Great old fashioned dinner in a cool building. Service was top notch. Great breakfast!
Wait was very short.  Our waitress Theresa was amazing.  The food came out quickly and was very good. Recommend this place.

Delicious food ! Party of five had our food within just a couple minutes of ordering.  One in our party mentioned the sausage links were cold.  I had original Benedict it was great !   House coffee was really good.  Other downside would be bathroom access is a pain having to get a key and take a bit of a hike to the basement of the building.  To find this place , keep an eye on the alcoves as you walk down the sidewalk. It's on the south side of the road you will see a menu by the door.  Also building is discretely stamped "The Pittsfield building"

As a previous reviewer mentioned this is a tricky place to find but you enter the building ( just past Toni's patisserie). Really cool inside a really old hotel style with a big chandelier hanging. There is indoor and outdoor seating. We sat outdoors( really inside but outside ) I had fresh squeezed orange juice and the Greek skillet 3 scrambled eggs with mushrooms feta tomatoes on top of hash browns came with toast too. You must try the pecan role insanely good. Fast service and a friendly waitress and reasonably priced too. I would recommend this place

Great food, great service, great location! We were looking for great breakfast food yesterday morning and we found this great place in a wonderful, historic location! Hopefully we'll be back the next time we visit Chicago!

Average diner in my book. Setting is also a little dismal since this place is tucked away in a lobby where there are NO, ZERO, NIL windows allowing for outdoor light to come in.  Had their Florentine benedict. Nice sauce, hash browns could have been better. Coffee was constantly refilled. Pay up front when you get your check. Decent breakfast joint.

I had a disappointing breakfast here today. The setting is sort of semi-hidden, inside the lobby area of the Pittsfield Building, and the place is set up diner-style with tables and a long lunch counter. So far, so good. Service is generally pretty quick, and most of the things I had were fine. Fine, but certainly not memorable in any way. Whenever I get unburnt coffee in a diner setting, that's a plus, so that was good. Freshly squeezed OJ was indeed freshly squeezed, also good. But the rest? Meh. Toast was nearly cold. Had to ask for butter, cream for my coffee, etc. The service was actually rushed - too much so, given that the place was busy but not even full. Servers are almost brusque as a result, one of the non-diner-like aspects. I had the corned beef hash, which honestly, wasn't. I love the stuff but am pretty forgiving of variations, just come close. But this was shredded corned beef, sort of tossed with onion and green pepper pieces and about 0.1 oz of potatoes. Nothing tasted like it had been cooked together; it was more like a salad. And the great flavor melding you get from the "hash" just can't be there. Overall, in a city with many other breakfast options, I'm not sure why you'd choose this one.

Simple. Delicious. Food. Sometimes when you order something so simple your expectations are high and you are disappointed.  That is not the case here.  I loved the food and the people.  The chef's skillet had perfectly cooked eggs and I would recommend that dish anytime.  I was sad I did not have room to try their waffles. They looked and smelled great next to me. I'll be back for those another time.

Truly a hidden gem! Located inside the Pittsfield building, this cute cafe, which has been here for 55 years, has fast and friendly service and great food! A great alternative to the place around the corner where the wait was 45 minutes.

Kind of difficult to find this place, but very cool once you get there. It is inside an old building so you walk in and walk forward a bit into a dimly lit lobby and it is on your left. There is "outdoor" seating that is inside the lobby but just outside the restaurant itself. Interesting diner type of feel with friendly and speedy service. The menu has lots of options including interesting scrambles and skillets. I had the Greek skillet which had onions, mushrooms, feta and hash browns with three eggs on top, cooked however you'd like. Quite good and definitely very filling. It also came with toast.  If I come back I will try their breakfast burrito which looked really good.

Two thumbs way up on this hidden gem! I found this place on yelp and passed a few other breakfast places that were packed, but this one is a little hidden and almost full but had a couple of table available. They food was home cooked, and came very fast. The waitress was very kind and attentive and I would recommend it to anyone in Chicago! The building was beautiful, as well!

Decent breakfast in an awesome, well-preserved building.  The food is honest-to-goodness diner fare, tucked away inside the interior "courtyard" of the Pittsfield building, which is like stepping back in time to the 1930's or 1940's, when you could imagine folks coming down to get lunch and shop at the adjacent "Tobacco and Gift Shop".  Great location for folks working in the Loop, or visitors staying in the Loop who are seeking a good, straightforward breakfast.

Super sweet Italian owner makes you feel at home in this little diner style café. The food is comforting and while not outstanding, it is definitely satisfying and diner-like.  Giant portions and a very busy atmosphere really add a little bit of Italian style eating to your meal. Guaranteed to fulfill your hunger needs every time. Was fortunate enough to talk to the owner and exchange a joke, and he is an absolute sweetheart. He even threw in a few York patties with our to-go boxes and honestly made my day. It does get a bit crowded around breakfast and brunch hours so make sure you beat the crowds!definitely satisfied my hunger.

This was our first breakfast in Chicago. It was well rated and not too far from our hotel. There is not much outdoor signage which we knew going there so it was not much of a problem. It is an old building, the Pittsfield Buliding, right near the lobby. It has a diner feel even though it is in this old building. We were seated immediately and our waitress was with us very shortly there after. My wife & I both ordered the Avocado Benedict, avocado instead of Canadian bacon. It was probably the fastest service I have had at any sit down restaurant. We had our food in less than 5 minutes. The Benedict was very good. The hash browns were good shredded potatoes but nothing out of the ordinary. Would go back again for sure.

Just gorgeous.  Had a skillet and the stuffed croissant. Prices are excellent and portions are good; not overly huge but satisfying.  Lovely service and a neat vibe given that you're sitting in an old art deco building that has the feel of an old train station. Would absolutely return.
If you're a table of four, expect to wait 20+ minutes for a table, then 10+ to get a drink order. Disorganized staff. Not worth the wait.

This place is absolutely amazing. It is located in an old; historical building. You would't notice it if you walk in the street, you must know it's here in order to find it. The place is usually busy. I like having brunch on a terrace, enjoying sun light, so I was a little bit disappointed by the fact that they are only inside... but the disappointment was short. We were seated quickly even though it was a rainy Saturday morning... then we had a wonderful brunch!!! It started with a freshly squeezed orange juice, shortly followed by the 2-2-2 combo, the croissant breakfast sandwich and a huge stack of pancakes. Food was delicious, portions large enough for my huge appetite. I had a wonderful time there! Also, the staff is very friendly and efficient; even though they are under-numbered.

This place was tucked in Pittsfield Building.  No signage on the street that makes it hard to find just walking by, but once you find it you will get a very solid breakfast. The seating is very limited and you are on top of each other.  The staff was friendly. The price was right for the amount of food.  I got the southwest skillet that had the right amount of heat thanks to the fresh sliced jalapenos.  Definitely a great way to fill up before a long day of walking.

For the last two days, I couldn't make it to the wildly popular wildberry cafe without the 1 hour wait, so I walked down the street to this old world joint. I actually quite like the place. Inside an old building, this is the quintessential American diner. All menu items are wonderfully familiar and what I ordered are nicely cooked and tasty. It is not a hip joint, but if you enjoy the atmosphere of a Edward Hopper painting, you'll like this place.

So came here mainly because Wildberry down the street had an hour and a half wait and it was raining so we would have gotten soaked. Seemed like a good idea at the time. Got here and we had a very hard time finding the place we called for directions (is inside the building where chase bank is). We asked if they had a wait. Lady on the phone said no wait. We get in and there was a wait of about 15mins, not bad, but how do u lie to ur potential customers?! FYI-We only walked across the street.  Anyhow, we were wet and hungry so we stayed. Atmosphere is tragic. Sad, dim looking place with tables in lobby of building. We sat outside and waited, finally the buzzer brought us water. We waited for another 15mins or so and the waitress kept walking by complaining about how busy it was. Um, don't u want business? We ordered a cup of coffee and a soda cuz the water tastes like chlorine tap water. They brought my coffee, I noticed the creamer that needs refrigeration was warm from sitting on the table too long, so I asked the buzzer for some cold creamer since our waitress was no where in sight. He didn't seem happy and without answering grabbed my bowl of creamers and I see him put my bowl of warm creamers back in the fridge and get a new one out...  that's going to make someone sick. He returns and we say thank you he just throws the bowl on the table and walks off.  Another 10 mins or so go by and they bring my order but not my wife's. The waitress tells us that she doesn't have her order because "someone, decided to steal your steak", (she had order the steak burrito). It arrived after another 10-15 mins. At this point they still had not brought her soda out. We reminded the waitress and it took her an additional 5 mins to get it.  The food... Bad. Just bad. Whoever said the corned beef was the best they had ever had, man... Long stretch buddy, another review stated it was like lunch meat with potatoes and sadly I have to agree, tasted like a fatty chewy hotdog... my wife's burrito tasted like they had fried beef jerky in some rancid oil. My wife liked the waffle that's why the one star. In my opinion it was like eating crispy cardboard. Absolutely no flavor.  Should have waited at the other restaurant, there's a reason they have a long wait. We heard other patrons saying they've never seen it this busy and now, I know why.

Wow a true hidden Gem. Next to the Chase building. Worth finding this location. I would compare it to a New York Diner. Breakfast - Lunch - Brunch you choose. The food was fresh and delicious. Also felt like we went back in time as we stepped into this place. Friendly service as well. Prices are so fair you will be surprised what a deal it was to eat here.
The Pittsfield Cafe breakfast sandwich is by far the best I have ever had in my life! If I lived close to Pittsfield Cafe, I would go here very ofton! Also extremely fast and friendly service!
Good solid breakfast. My wife had the Avocado Benedict and I had biscuits and gravy. My wife's pet peeve is an under or over cooked poached egg; they were perfectly poached.

Although I found it difficult to find on the street (it's inside the Pittsfiled building and I couldn't find a sign anywhere for the life of me, maybe it's just due to the construction at the moment) when I went through the revolving doors I immediately saw the chairs set up outside of the joint. A bit of a greasy spoon, but I mean that in the most endearing way possible as that is exactly what I was looking for that day. This has got to be the cheapest food in the city but without sacrificing quality whatsoever; besides, it's breakfast food, what could you complain about? Highly recommended if you're looking for overeasy eggs hashbrowns bacon a cup of joe and a milkshake to finish you off. I waited 12 months when I was overseas for a good American breakfast meal like this and it did not disappoint. plus, it all cost me under 10 bucks!
This place is inside the building hard to find.  The food is ok.

First off thecafe is located in the pitsburg building which i didnt know when i was actually looking for it ( stood in front of it with my phone saying im there and me scratching my head). Nice little resturant with outdoor ( within the building) or indoor seating. we sat outdoor and they had fans blowing to make sure it didnt get to hot and it really wasnt bad at all. We ordered 2x2x2 plate denver omelette and a steak omelette 2 coffees and some fresh squeezed oj. Food came out pretty fast and hot, the omelette was pretty good but the hashbrowns that came qith it was plain. It had no flavor i had to put alot of ketchup and pepper to be able to get it down. I would go there again the building is very beautiful and the food was pretty good

Firstly, the cafe is located in the historic Pittsfield Building, an immaculately preserved art deco building emblazened with the glitz and glamour of the 1920's. Step into the cafe and you're transported to the American diners of the 50s and 60s, a la Route 66. In fact, you couldn't get more Americana unless a Bald Eagle landed in your eggs and pooped the stars and stripes. But I digress.. The joint is family run, with 2 generations at the door. 'Pops' will greet you with a smile, then send his son over for the dirty business of seating you. The menu is extensive, with All Day Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner options. The decor matches the menu - think American staples like meatloaf, hot dogs and burgs, steak and eggs and silver dollar pancakes. Nothin' fancy, just classic good eats. Each visit (spoiler alert: we came back 3 times in as many days), I opted for The Sampler - one of the all-day breakfast items that includes 2 pieces of French Toast, 2 scrambled eggs, hash potatoes and 2 strips of bacon. For less than $10, you get a serious cup of Italian coffee paired with a more-than-adequate plate of food. The boys behind the counter work some kind of magic, because in mere minutes they whipped up the best french toast I've ever had. Simple, eggy (but not soggy), paired with hot and fluffy scrambled eggs, and perfectly cooked (RE: crispy but not TOO crispy) bacon, piled on top of creamy (but not too greasy), hash. Erm, that was the long way of saying everything was perfect. Seriously.  Top that with exceptional service, no wait times (the cafe is hidden from the tourist crowds), and less than $10 for a filling and tasty meal, it's safe to say we hit the vacation jackpot. Cheap, cheerful, and by far some of the best food we ate on our trip. That said, this isn't the place for Hipsters or the food elite. But if you're looking for wholesome, down home, American staples, then you will leave satisfied (and come back again and again).  Your wallet with thank you too! Tip: They are CLOSED on SUNDAYS. We found out the hard way.

loved this cozy brunch place. even though we had a group of this, they kindly accommodated all of us. Teresa was an awesome waitress and was flexible when we needed to split our checks. we will definitely be back!
Food was AMAZING, service was FAST, and prices were CHEAP. Freshly squeezed OJ is a MUST! loved this place!

This is just a good straight up no frills diner with solid food. The prices are great and the service is fast. In a town like Chicago this isn't the usual case. The restaurant itself is located in quite the scenic building, doesn't seem like it really even bongs there. As a bonus, the staff working here is very friendly. I got the florentine benedict and it was super tasty, eggs were perfectly poached.
Super fast breakfast.  Literally was out in 5 minutes. Very nice and friendly servers! Tucked in a BEAUTIFUL building. watch for it or you'll miss it!  Worth the look if you're passing by

Cute little diner feel, without the greasy diner taste  . They have lots of breakfast options and lunch as well .  They have a rather large menu . The staff was super nice and the decor was very homy. It's inside a older building and they have a spot for seating in what looks like use to be a lobby area ( and might still be I am not sure ). Super cool feel , it was a outside patio experience inside !  You can order meals or they have a la carte options . I got a English muffin sandwich, with one egg and cheese , with a side of turkey sausage  . The man got a omelet with hash browns and toast ! Both were made fresh ! I recommend this place hangover or no hangover .  Great food , great price and great service !   Just allow some extra time for the whole dining experience .
Hidden gem! Pleasant waitress, fast service, delicious croissant sandwich! Brie & onion jam made it unique....yum!
Solid...good old down to earth good cookin!! And at a fair price..and friendly service...what more could one want?

This place is hidden for a reason!  Dirty and disgusting!  The waitstaff is rude and nasty. I witnessed my waitress wipe her nose and then make a customers toast. Touch money and then food without washing their hands. The omelets we ordered were burnt along with the dry hash browns.  They served the orange juice out of buckets. The tables and chairs were dirty. I do not recommend this place at all!!
No frills, priced very reasonably, and a simple and nice atmosphere. Service was very prompt and food was cooked well. Would definitely recommend for a breakfast stop.
Great food, cheap prices, good service and amazing location. It's in the middle of the building which has amazing architecture. A pretty perfect diner.

This is a no frills kind of place. It's a hidden gem. The server got right to the point, got our food out, and cleaned our table off. It was dirt cheap for Chicago standards, but a great portion and good food. I had the corned beef hash and it was delicious. I added an egg on top of it. My friend got the sampler platter and couldn't finish it. Our bill was under $20. Definitely recommend this place.

A solid diner within an old lobby. The eggs were not cooked over medium, as ordered, but were over easy. The hash brown potato is the stringy type which isn't my personal favorite and it was slightly under cooked. A solid greasy spoon worth the visit if in need of a cooked brekkie in the loop.
Great breakfast,  loved the skillet.  I didn't see a sign outside,  go in the posted address and you will find it.

Great, fast breakfast at this spot.   Get there before 10 on a weekend.   We had regular breakfast fare, pancakes, eggs, bacon, French toast, and it was all in point!  Service was great and we our bill was cheap!  One pointer : if you want to use the bathroom, get the key BEFORE you go downstairs.  That isn't advertised at the top of the stairs.

This is by far the absolute WORST dining experience ever!  You would expect that a diner can efficiently and quickly take an order and deliver it to the table.. Not so at this place,  orders that are placed take nearly 40 minutes to be delivered and when they are the food is cold, stinks of old grease and is disgusting!  I ordered 2 eggs, 2 slices of bacon, hash browns and toast.  Pretty simple right? Evidently not.  Save your calories, save your stomach.  This place is the worst!   BTW- you can't post a review with 0 stars... So the 1 star is only because I didn't have the option of posting a 0.

Perfect in every way. Drank too much last night? This is the place. Too many Grateful Dead concerts in a row? This is the place. Overtired and underfed? Get in here!  The eggs were cooked to perfection and service was salty like my bacon. I love a career server who gets it done.  Great menu, many options. Exactly what I needed when I needed it. As if the breakfast gods conspired to create heaven on Earth.  It's not farm to table but it's certainly hand to mouth.  Thanks Pittsfield Cafe for a real good time!
Good breakfast.  Hot and fast. My wife likes her bacon crispy, and that's the way it comes out! Restaurant has a 1950's feel. The waitress was very attentive.

Walked all the way over here to see a sign on the entrance saying closed for July 4th. UPDATED YOJR ANSWERING MACHINE if you are going to be closed during your normal business hours! I called before and the phone just rings and rings with no answering machine at all. So annoying
Charged extra for sharing an entree and had audacity to ask for a bigger tip...how rude!
We didn't know where to eat breakfast and yelped to find a local spot. The food is reasonable and tastes great! No complaints from our party of 6!
Great little place, if you can find it, inside an older building. Great diner food. It is cheap and the food came out in about 5 mins, so great if you are in a hurry.
Their fresh OJ is sooo good! Corned beef hash is delicious and not too salty. I was on a business trip for 3 days in Chicago and I went here for breakfast two days in a row!

No frills, no wait and good food. Came for breakfast on a Saturday and it was nice to not find myself in a tourist trap. Old school diner feel. Fast and efficient service with no frills. Prices are reasonable. Worth checking out for sure.

Excellent for brunch. Friendly, attentive service. Cool, classic Chicago downtown vibe. A diner with everything that makes diners so good. Also some nice surprises on the menu. Try the avacado skillet.

Ok - we went here because of the descent yelp reviews and because of the Art Deco historical interior of the lobby where this diner is situated ! The Art Deco interiors are indeed beautiful but that's where the positives end !  The food and coffee were just awful ! The coffee is watered down and our food was suspiciously ready in 1 minute!!!!! I had a corned beef omelet . The meat was old , the eggs were dry , no flavor . My friends bacon was overly dry and his sandwich semi cold ! We did not finish our food . Just paid and left hungry !! The service would of been ok if we were at the road side dive in rural Illinois and not in this beautiful Art Deco building in the middle of a major city !  Ps : I very rarely leave bad reviews , but the  food there was just below average !!!

Thanks Yelp for helping me find this hidden gem.  I've worked nearby for months and didn't know it was here.   I ordered the Steak Skillet.  It was delivered less than 10 minutes after I ordered it, QUICK service.  Tasted great and was fairly priced.  Came with toast. They not only have the cafe interior, but they place some tables just out the door in the lobby area which would be more comfortable for larger groups.

This is the quintessential breakfast diner. Nothing special here. The prices are very low considering its location. The food is good, but surely nothing to brag about. Think greasy spoon with more omelette options.
This place is a hidden gem in the loop. And for the low low. My gawd. . Had le croissant. Amaze balls.
Great food and quick! Extremely reasonable prices and just about everything comes with hashbrowns and toast. Coffee was good and service was ok given the crowd.

Used Yelp AGAIN to find this place. Long waits and short menus meant finding another option. This place looked close so we started the hunt. As other reviews mention, it's difficult to find. Its called the Pittsfield Cafe because of the building its in. Haha who would think of that?! Food was good and priced right. Waitstaff was on point. Nice sized $7 omelette with hash browns and toast. Coffee is hot and fresh for $2. Plenty of options for breakfast or brunch. Eggs, skillets, huge homemade waffles, pancakes, omelettes, fruit and juices. More stuff on the lunch and dinner part of the menu, but I didn't look at it because I was there for breakfast. Super cool old building with lots of brass fixtures. Definitely worth a look.

I've been going here for years (I sure miss Audrey) since the owners' father was actually running the register. Pancakes are the absolute best I've ever had. They are the only ones I can ever finish a serving of, no matter where I go. Eggs are always fresh, and now they take debit cards. I always order the 2-2-2, it's my favorite.

Great little cafe "hidden" inside an astute looking office building. What a gem! I sat at the bar and had great service.  I ordered the Greek omelette and cranberry juice.  The juice was from a bottle rug hot in their open air cooler, even though u was hoping for fresh. No big deal.  The omelette was very generous sized with hash browns and toast. The eggs were fluffy and the veggies crisp. Lots of meat and cheese in the omelette. Honestly it was too much for one person to eat but it tasted great and I ate it all anyway!   Prices were extremely reasonable for Chicago ands eating plentiful.  It's a very casual place with beautiful views of the building that surrounds it.    Definitely recommended?

A hidden gem of a breakfast cafe right in the heart of the city! It took me a minute or two to find the place!  Yelp doesn't mention it's inside the building!!! The food is very good, well prepared, and very good portions!!!  I think it's actually underpriced, so it comes to a great value!!

This place was recommended by the staff at The Hard Rock and it delivered!  The staff was great and very accommodating to our party that went from 4 to 12 over a period of 2 hours.  Teresa was awesome and handled the bills faster than your average casual dining place. This is a great place with a solid selection of options!

We found this diner on Yelp after going to Wildberry and having an hour and a half wait. It was an easy walk, a little hard to find because it is in the Pittsfield building kind of in the back. The service was friendly and fast, the corned beef hash skillet I had was super good and a perfect portion size. The atmosphere wasn't the best, since it was in the middle of an office building lobby there were no windows or outside seating, but other than that it was an older diner feel to it. So it has its charm, but not exactly the best city brunch atmosphere. The food and service were exactly what we were looking for, and my friends mimosa was delicious too! I would recommend if you are looking for a fast but delicious diner breakfast and coffee close to The Loop!

This diner is located smack dab in the middle of the lobby of the Pittsfield Building.  It's a bit odd, but also charmingly quirky.  I like to sit "al fresco" (in the lobby seating) and generally order an omelette for lunch, though their lunch menu churns out competent renditions of American diner cuisine.  Cash only can be a PITA if you aren't used to carrying bills.  Thankfully there's an ATM available if you forget.
Looking for cheap brunch in the loop? Come here. Portions are good and the food isn't bad.

Agreed with several others that the entrance is hidden but the building inside is great, the food was delicious and super affordable, and service was very fast. And after stopping by Wildberry where there was an insane wait, we were seated immediately at Pittsfield!

This was our second option for breakfast/brunch since the original spot had a long line outside the building. Glad we came here for breakfast/brunch. Plenty of options to choose from. Ordered the meat lovers omelette, did not disappoint.  Great service, friendly servers. Totally budget friendly. Cost us $30 for 2 people and we ate penalty. Would come back again. Now to take on the sights and chilly weather of Chicago.

Had high hopes for this place. The corned beef hash tasted like it was made with day old hash browns and the biscuits and gravy had a funny taste. I didn't even finish them which almost never happens with me and any food. The only reason I'm giving 3 stars is  because my husband's steak skillet dish was good and the building lobby is fun.

We had lunch here today at about 3.00.  The cafe is located inside a building and a little challenging to find if you don't know the area.  The menu is quite expansive for a small cafe but the service and food excelled.  The vegetable soup was homemade and the spinach pie was delicious.  Our waitress was attentive without hovering and drink glasses were refilled without asking.  I would definitely go back, you can't find too many places where two people can have a meal for less than $20.

The entrance was a little hidden since the main door was closed, but I'm so glad we made the effort of finding this place. We went to Wildberry first and there was an hour wait, then we went to Toni's and they were expensive with a very small menu, so we searched this place down. We made the right decision! I had Le Croissant with the carmelized onion jam - soooooo delicious! Our waitress was also very awesome and friendly. The price was great. Fast service. Only issue is that it was a little cramped inside the cafe and difficult to find.

I love Pittsfield. I work nearby and order from them all the time. Most of the staff are friendly, but I have had a few less than average interactions. Because my service is usually great, I just write the few bad experiences off as a bad day. The food is delicious, diner food if that's what you're looking for. I strongly recommend their breakfast. I'm a Southern girl and I LOVE their grits. Delivery is usually quick and worth the extra charge if the weather is bad.
Good solid breakfast place right in the heart of the loop. Friendly fast staff. A neat location tucked inside the Pittsfield building. A great alternative to the shishi pastry/coffee shops nearby.

An interesting location - inside the lobby of an ornate older building. Food was a bit of a let down. Had the avocado eggs benedict. Eggs were decent, but the avocado was a bit brown/ rancid. Boyfriend had a veggie egg scramble - okay, but nothing to go out of your way for. Ended up here for a quick breakfast (if we had time, we would've gotten in line at Yolk!)
Great little breakfast place. Super busy. Staff was nice and was working their butt off. I had french toast- not bad. Not amazing. Small diner that bring you back to the old days.

Good diner with fast and friendly service. The Veggie omelette with feta added was great! I was a fan of the hash browns too, ordered extra crispy. My wife ordered French toast with fresh strawberries - also delicious. The fresh squeezed OJ was great too.  I recommend the diner, but the location in the stunning Pittfield Building makes this a real gem in the city.

I'm not a fan of diners, but this was as good as it gets. Quick service, great coffee, and they made my picky breakfast for me! So good, and one of the best deals in town! I suggest going to this little gem if your on a budget!

Okay spot- was nice to be able to sit down right away with no wait on a Saturday morning. I tried the breakfast burrito which I'm glad I got the chipotle hollandaise on the side because it SO spicy! My husband had an omlette who said it was like an average diner. So - great if you're hungry and don't want to spend a lot or wait a long time- but not a destination.

Affordable and delicious! you have to walk INTO the building where the Chase is located and it is in the center of the building. There is outdoor seating, the lighting is dim, but no matter, we had great Saturday brunch for under $25. It was the best meal we had in Chicago.  I ordered the french toast, two eggs, and two strips of bacon and large fresh squeezed orange juice. All were delicious, the juice is about 10 oz small has to be closer to 6-8oz. My friend ordered the silver dollar pancakes w/hashbrowns and enjoyed them. The staff were pleasant, our water glass kept full, and we left happy and filled.  This is a wheelchair accessible space, but getting into the building may be a challenge as there is only 1 area that is not one of those big heavy doors or revolving doors. I didn't use the restroom so not sure about that accessibility.

Horrible, horrible place! The hostess ignored us and was trying to placate a much older group about the long wait times even though we had come earlier than them. There were plenty of tables open interspersed with the regular tables and no one was cleaning/getting them ready for like 20 minutes. We just ended up leaving. Basically, don't go here....

Delicious breakfast! They have a great menu with tons of variety. Food comes out fast and the service is very attentive. Whether you are dining alone or with a small group, they are able to accommodate you quickly.  One of my favorites in the city!

They were so wonderful there! Today was my first time there and when I arrived the lunch rush was just winding down and I was waiting for a friend alone. The waitresses kept me laughing and told me their favorite picks for the menu, which by the way has so much variety, my le croissant was a little dry but everything else was great. Wonderful atmosphere just like a classic diner and also has great background music. Whether your looking for breakfast, brunch, lunch, or early dinner this place is great

Digusting! This can't be Greek owned. I got a flat, dry chicken breast that was so badly seasoned with, I don't know what. They graced me with a little tomato and some lettuce. It was supposed to have onions and tomatoes (not tomato) as well. I grew up in a Greek community. I worked in Greek restaurants. I've dined at all of the diners and restaurants in Chicago and this was horrible. $10

What a cute little hidden gem! Pittsfield Cafe is a quaint little diner located inside the gorgeous atrium of the Historic Pittsfield Building. The inside is an old diner with a vintage feel, while the outside has charming cafe-style seating inside the atrium. It's a perfect place to grab a delicious cheap bite to eat in the winter, since if gives you that outdoor cafe vibe (indoors). It's also an excellent place for breakfast with a friend. They serve a delicious cup of bottomless coffee. They have a large variety of creative omelets and skillets. Everything comes with toast and jelly. They make their omelets with real eggs (no fake fluffy fillers). I'm definitely coming here again! Check it out.

I love the Pittsfield Building, it's got that old "city of the big shoulders" feel, with it's large base towering to an early skyscraper height on the outside, the ornamentation in the lobby, and a courtyard on the inside. And this is where the Pittsfield Cafe sits. You won't see it from the street, but just walk through the doors of the building and keep going, straight ahead, past the elevators. Inside is a courtyard. It's almost like dining on a square, like eating at an indoor "patio."  We were here on a Saturday "morning" (noon on Saturday is mid-morning, in my book), and the square was quite peaceful. We hung out until they were closing, but there was no rush to get us out of there as they started to clean the tables; on the contrary, they told us to stay as long as we liked.  Like others here have said, the corned beef hash is excellent, the menu is filled with standard breakfast fare at reasonable prices. The coffee is not Intelligentsia, but still well quaffable, with no hipster trying to convince you that you need a little pot with an s-shaped spout to "pour over" coffee grounds that are measured to the gram. The service is friendly and efficient. The Toni Patisserie is through a hallway if you want to spend the same amount on a macaroon and cappuccino as you just did for a full breakfast here. I confess, I can't resist a macaroon; but I opted for being an Italian and had an espresso. By then it was afternoon, and it would be uncouth in Roma to have a cappuccino after morning.

I ordered the Sampler which consisted of french toast, hash-brown, eggs & bacon (I chose scrambled eggs & pork bacon). Food was semi warm, but it wasn't bad. The best part about the meal was actually the french toast & super crispy bacon ... the rest I wasn't able to finish. Found a used bandage stuck on the menu and a short strand of hair in the food prior to eating -- that contributed to losing my appetite.  The overall experience could have been better. However, service was subpar. They came to check up on us, but the attitude the staff gave off wasn't the friendliest.  Regardless I'd give this place 3 stars due to the reasonable price, awesome french toast, crispy bacon and the unique location.

I've been here a few times. The food is pretty decent, and the prices are good for it. It's a good place to eat if you aren't sure at you want. They have a wide variety of simple options for breakfast, lunch and dinner. A good place to go if you're in a hurry and aren't sure what you're in the mood for. Also, I've literally never waited more than 10 minutes for food here. I usually have my food in 3-4 minutes.

So this place is super hard to find, almost felt like I should eat here because it looks high frills, super expensive and all highfalutin.  But i decided to give it a try.  The tables are ginormous, very spacious inside.  The waitress hardly pays attention to you, my coffee cup was always empty and breakfast took forever to arrive.  The bill came and couldn't believe how much a couple of eggs cost here! Now take the OPPOSITE of everything I just said and there you go.

Staying at the Burnham Hotel down the street. Hotel restaurant is being renovated. I found about Pittsfield Cafe on Google. The service was fast and the staff very friendly. The Manager advised that the way I ordered my omlete was too expensive and gave me a different price!  I will be back for lunch!

Location: Hidden inside the old Pittsfield building. Marvelous architecture. The cafe itself has an old school diner feel. It's as if I took a time machine. Hidden gem.  Service: No wait. Fast. Gets the job done. We literally sat down and ordered and 10 minutes later our food was ready. Staff is friendly.  Food: Classic all american diner with the staples. Excellent food that's made well.

I ordered as much food as I could handle for this hour of the morning...on a weekday (8 am-ish). Veggie Scramble with cheddar cheese, hashbrowns, wheat toast and a side of grits. The portions were decent, though the grits left something to be desired (weren't hot enough - I'm a Southern girl, what can I say). BUT for the cost, I'd say I got my value's worth. And I'm full. Service was great, very very fast. I would come back.

My server is in such a hurry I couldn't completey order !!! She wouldn't even wait till I chose a side for my burger. Sigh...the food can best be described as mediocre. There are better places near this one. Don't waste your money and appetite here !
Hidden gem! Classic diner with great prices in the middle of downtown. The hashbrowns are good. Our waitress was so cute and nice. The food came out relatively fast.

Decent find. Diner is located inside the building, had a difficult time finding it. Nice nicer feel, decent prices. My husband got an inlet that was a nice portion. I got a skillet that was a little small and I added gyro meet which they were skimpy on. But the food had good flavor. Lots of options.
service was bad! i was still drinking my coffee but that waiter asked to leave soon because i've been sitting there for too long! how can you do that to a costumer?

Put one in the win column. Like a neighborhood diner and prices in the loop. Not on the scale of a "Golden fill-in-the-blank" but a practical option for a sit down breakfast. Situated on the first floor inside an older building with seating inside as a diner, or outside in the lobby like a sidewalk café. I went for a breakfast there today ~9 in the morning. The place was pretty empty. I ordered a 2+2+2 breakfast with corned beef has on the side, and a cup of coffee. Solid food with a big helping of hash. Hash is chopped corned beef, hash brown potato strings, and onions, fried up together- not from-the-can slop. Mate had a "Western" omelette of decent heft. Very good prices considering the location with breakfast combinations between $5-$10. Attentive staff, fresh coffee. I think this is the place to go if you're not having the gluten free natural wheat soy biscuits and maki lattes popular with the commuting crowd.

We went there because our breakfast place of choice had a long wait.  This place had no wait.  It's a decent, basic diner.  The breakfast was fine for us. Good omelet, good bacon.  Nothing special, just good, basic food. Coffee was just ok.  They accepted our AMEX card, so I'm not sure why others had a problem with AMEX.
Don't know why others rated it low. For us (tourists) it's a beautiful oasis of peace, friendly, with great food. In the words of my daughter: Best breakfast of the whole trip...

Ate here in the morning before walking over to Cloud Gate, solid service, inside a corporate building. No frills, gets the job done. Look for the address placard out front, it'll take you right to it. Good: -Get there before 11am for the breakfast specials -Fresh Corn Beef Hash -South of the Boarder Omelet -Triple Cheese Omelet -Delicious coffee in big cups -A block away from Millennium Park & Cloud Gate -Nice quiet atmosphere, enjoy the view/moment Bad: -Closer to 11am, the cook ran out of all Eggs Benedict dishes

I went in here with not very high expectations based on all the different reviews. But I was very pleasantly surprised. Both myself and the person I was with enjoyed our food. It was pretty busy, but the food came out very quickly. Overall great experience and service.

It's in the old Pittsfield Building, which is pretty darn dilapidated looking on the inside. The inside of the cafe actually feels like an old-school diner, so that was cool. I got the corned beef hash, and it's a TON. I came with my girlfriend, and she ordered a pastrami has, and she couldn't even finish half of it. It's a lot of food, folks. I loved mine, but it probably comes with a tad too much cheese. The corned beef is really special though. Mmmmmmm... The food is definitely not the fanciest, but it's prepared well. Don't expect any truffle oil or goat cheese or whatever -- this is a hearty, classic All-American diner experience. Honestly, the staples here are better than those from Wildberry. And there's no wait. Will definitely come again if I'm not in the mood to break the bank with a fancy brunch place.
No frills diner. Service was fast but the food was mediocre. Decent spot to stop in a pinch and get warm, though.

Great food and quick service...all you are looking for in a diner...I know it's not their fault but the bathroom was pretty bad...kind of a big deal after coffee for breakfast. Only reason for not giving 4 stars
Quick and friendly service.  No frills diner, with affordable prices and generous servings.
Good service, the food was good & the prices are reasonable. They don't take American Express. It is within walking distance from all the downtown hotels.

I came here to try a new place after walking past this place countless times and never stopping in to actually eat here. It was ok, but good if you want decent food for a reasonable price. Our waitress Marcella was wonderful she was friendly and took our orders despite the kitchen closing up and that we were allowed to eat our food before they closed for the day. It was nice and I'll definitely come back since the breakfast served all day was selling point for me since I do like breakfast items for lunch or dinner. The architecture is worthwhile to camera happy tourists, but to locals it's just another old office building you walk past downtown. If you're looking for something quick and inexpensive this is your place to come to. It's not ideal for groups bigger than 3-4 people it's too small inside the actual diner they do have tables and chairs outside in their lobby if there's more than 3 people. They do have flat screen tvs you can watch from the booth tables and counters.
No frills diner, what you see is what you get.  Also, although they advertise taking credit cards, they don't take American Express.

Really just ok food. Had corner beef hash omelet and hash browns but neither was anything to write home about. Alas.  Interesting architecture for the lobby but that's no reason to go eat here. Just take your pictures and move on.

Really bad attitude of the guy who tried to sit us. He wouldn't let my 2 friends sit with me bc they were leaving in 5 min.  This is despite having multiple tables open. He said they were "too busy" Ugh

Excellent but hidden breakfast spot in busy downtown Chicago. Not fancy or pretentious, just outstanding food. The menu was extensive and the service extremely friendly. The best part...no wait. Don't wait in line. Go here and you won't be disappointed.

First off, the location is the coolest part if this place. It's inside what seems like an old hotel or something and they have an "outdoor" patio, which is inside the indoor terrace of the building, which was really cool. Other than that, it's basically just a glorified diner. He good was pretty average and the service was not great. Since we sat "outside" our waitress had to walk really far from the kitchen to our table, not to mention that she was one of 2 waitresses working and the other waitress served food to people in her section before us even though her group sat down after our group. Food was good, but again nothing special.

I almost even wish I could give this place a zero star. While the food was good the experience was AWFUL. They wouldn't sit us at a table and made us wait outside then sat a table full of people before is who just walked in. After we sat down or server was flustered and the owner or manager was yelling at workers right in front of us. The food was ok but I ordered a "plain omelet" that was just eggs, when I asked for cheese the server told me that's what I ordered and I was basically wrong. She took me plate back to add cheese and have me back just Kraft cheese melted on top of my plain eggs. Terrible service and just ok food. Would never go back.

Mostly cons here for me.  Hard to find.  Is within a building with out a sign out front.   Once in we were sat just before 11am. When the waitress came it was after 11. At this time the items are no longer sErved and others go up up in price. Service was sub par.  Coffee arrived with the meal.  The famed corn beef hash was nothing more than chopped lunch meat and potatoes.  HAd a stray sausage piece in there and I Don't do pork.  Overall just bad.

We had breakfast here on our stay in Chicago last weekend.  It was a little bit difficult to locate at first, but once we were there, we were pleasantly surprise.  This is a small, hidden cafe, but it was bustling with customers and activity.  The food was pretty good, typical cafe food and on-point for the price range.  I would come back.
Perfect service and cozy environment.... Big portion breakfast! Their skillet is great! Try it... Specially the pastrami one!

Outstanding food and service. The apple pancakes were delicious. The corned beef hash is the best I have ever had. Very close to Wildberry but better food and prices. It is a little hard to find because it is in a lobby of a building but find it and go!

Quickest breakfast delivery ever!  If you like typical diner food- you are in luck!  Except bigger portions, cooked to perfection & oh so yummy!  Staff was friendly and efficient!  The 1927 renovated Pittsfield building it's located in is gorgeous!

We didn't want to wait the hour and twenty for wild berries.  We found this awesome place on yelp and came on over.  Perplexed from the street.  You have to walk into building 55 on Washington.  Walking in is amazing.  It's an immediate time trip to the 30's.  The coffee is the best, the staff is super friendly and the food is exceptional!  We had the pancakes with Apple's and cinnamon.  They cook the apples in the pancakes.  Big pancakes.  Not greasy.  Santa fe grilled chicken breakfast burrito.  Amazing!   Almost tasted like a hand made tortilla.  I would totally recommend this place is you don't want to wait for wild berries.  Off now to visit the art museum.  Happy stomach and replenished soul.

I've been here at least 20 times, but on my last visit I finally took a close look at the bill.  Ordered a meat lovers omelette ($9.00) with two pancakes.  No coffee, no milk, no soda, just a water - tab was 15 bucks, not including tip. I said "no" to hash browns and toast, but these wankers charged me an extra $5.00 for two small pancakes. Seriously? C'mon, people, hook a brother up with some free cakes if I skip the toast and browns. If I ever go back, I'll skip the pancakes and order the hash browns and toast out of spite.

Neatly tucked inside an old skyscraper, this cafe is a worthwhile place to visit if you're downtown and need a quick breakfast.  It has both the pluses (quick, cost effective) and minuses (no the best service and pushy) of being a diner.

My wife and I visited Chicago last weekend and breakfasted twice at this classic courtyard cafe.   They also offer outdoor seating, nicely shaded, but next to the Elevated Train, so may get noisy from time-to-time.   Could be fun, but we were happy indoors.   Enjoyed some of their classic breakfast combos.   Blueberry pancakes were very tasty.   Fresh squeezed orange juice was top notch!   Service very friendly and attentive.   Also, pricing seemed very reasonable, especially given the convenient downtown location.

When in Chicago last weekend we were looking for a good big breakfast place before going to the White Sox vs Royals baseball game. We saw that Wildberry had a good rating and opted for that as our choice but when we got there it was an hour wait (looked like a lot of local people so it must be good). So I pulled out the old Yelp app and went for choice #2. The Pittsfield Cafe is a hidden gem in an old building that is kind of hidden or off the beaten path. The atmosphere in the lobby seating area was really cool. The food was good, fresh and fast and the service was wonderful. I would recommend this as a great breakfast spot when in the Windy City.
Friendly, quick service Bloody Mary is bangin' Food came out quickly and tasted delicious Beautiful building and location
